definition: to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to

sentences.english: The bad police officer in that movie thought he was above the law.
sentences.chinese: 那部电影中的坏警察自认不受法律的约束。

sentences.english: Chapter Three analyses the effectiveness of self-admission.
sentences.chinese: 第三章，对自认的效力进行分析。

sentences.english: Whoever is so confident to clarify whether this era is to be lauded or cursed?
sentences.chinese: 这个时代是该被赞美还是被诅咒，谁自认能说得清呢？

sentences.english: I met this guy in the market, he claimed himself to be Tong Pak Fu.
sentences.chinese: 夫人，我在苏州市集看到这个人自认是唐伯虎。

sentences.english: I know darn well, he'll convince me that he's right again.
sentences.chinese: 我自认倒霉，他会说服我，他又是对的。

sentences.english: In Part four is about the improvement of China's self-admission system.
sentences.chinese: 第四部分是关于我国民事诉讼自认制度的完善构想。

sentences.english: Her pleasing esthetics only makes this situation more vile.
sentences.chinese: 她自认愉悦的美学观只会使情况变得更加恶心。

sentences.english: In the next section, the author points out the three significances of admissions of right.
sentences.chinese: 最后，对肯定权利自认的意义作了三个方面的阐释。

sentences.english: The wise man knows he knows nothing, the fool thinks the knows all.
sentences.chinese: 聪明人自认一无所知，愚笨人自负无所不晓。

sentences.english: Who among them can think he could outguess you?
sentences.chinese: 他们有谁自认可以看透你？

sentences.english: Bob has a fancy new car, so he thinks he's so cool now.
sentences.chinese: 鲍伯有辆很漂亮的新车，所以他现在自认很酷。
我自认是个很猛的司机。

sentences.english: The museum, too, sees itself as activist.
sentences.chinese: 博物馆还自认是活跃分子。

sentences.english: Self-admission in this paper is self-admission on civil procedure, the nature is litigation contract.
sentences.chinese: 本文论述的是诉讼上的自认，性质是诉讼契约。

sentences.english: How can there be moments when I feel as if I understand it all?
sentences.chinese: 我岂有一刻敢自认是全知全能。

sentences.english: Listen to a joke at one's own expense.
sentences.chinese: 听一个含有自认倒楣，自我牺牲的笑话。

definition: to ask oneself/to search one's soul/to reach a conclusion after weighing a matter
to pose as/to flaunt oneself as/to boast of/to brag
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
let alone/to say nothing of/besides/what's more
